questions.question: Evaluate the definite integral \(\int_0^2 x^3\sqrt{x^4+9}\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_0^{\pi/4}\sec^2 x\tan x\,dx\).
questions.explanation: Let \(u=\tan x\), \(du=\sec^2 x\,dx\). When \(x=0\), \(u=0\); when \(x=\pi/4\), \(u=1\). Integral \(=\int_0^1 u\,du=\frac{u^2}{2}\big|_0^1=\frac{1}{2}\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_1^{e^5}\dfrac{3}{x}\,dx\).
A particle moves along the x‑axis with velocity \(v(t)=t^2-4t+3\) m/s. On the interval \([0,5]\), how many times does the particle change direction?
questions.explanation: Set \(v(t)=0\): \((t-1)(t-3)=0\) ⇒ \(t=1\) and \(t=3\). Check signs: \(v(0)=3>0\), \(v(2)=4-8+3=-1<0\), \(v(4)=16-16+3=3>0\). The velocity changes sign at both \(t=1\) and \(t=3\), so the particle changes direction 2 times.

questions.question: Find the average value of \(f(x)=\sin x\) on the interval \([0,\pi]\).
Let \(f(x)=x^3+4x-8\). Which of the following correctly applies the Intermediate Value Theorem to guarantee a zero on the given interval?
questions.explanation: IVT requires a sign change. \(f(1)=1+4-8=-3<0\) and \(f(2)=8+8-8=8>0\). Since \(f\) is continuous and changes sign on \([1,2]\), there is a zero there. The other intervals all have the same sign at both endpoints.

questions.question: Find the general solution to the differential equation \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=\dfrac{x^2}{y^3}\).
Let \(F(x)=\int_0^{x^5}\cos(t^2)\,dt\). Find \(F'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC Part 1 and the chain rule: \(F'(x)=\cos((x^5)^2)\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x^5)=\cos(x^{10})\cdot5x^4=5x^4\cos(x^{10})\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=e^{\sqrt{x}}\).
Find \(f'(x)\) if \(f(x)=\tan(x^2)\).
Let \(f(x)=\begin{cases}2x^2+1 & x\le2\\kx+3 & x>2\end{cases}\). What value of \(k\) makes \(f\) continuous at \(x=2\)?
questions.explanation: Left limit (and value): \(2(4)+1=9\). Right limit: \(2k+3\). Set equal: \(2k+3=9\) ⇒ \(k=3\). Verify: \(2(3)+3=9\) ✓

questions.question: Find all x‑values where \(f(x)=x^3-6x^2+9x+2\) has a point of inflection.
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=3x^2-12x+9\), \(f''(x)=6x-12=6(x-2)\). Set \(f''(x)=0\): \(x=2\). Since \(f''\) changes sign at \(x=2\) (negative for \(x<2\), positive for \(x>2\)), there is an inflection point at \(x=2\).

questions.question: Use implicit differentiation to find \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}\) for \(x^2+xy+y^2=7\).
Find the equation of the normal line to \(y=x^2+1\) at the point \((1,2)\).
questions.explanation: \(y'=2x\). At \(x=1\): tangent slope \(=2\). Normal slope \(=-\frac{1}{2}\). Equation: \(y-2=-\frac{1}{2}(x-1)\) ⟹ \(y=-\frac{1}{2}x+\frac{5}{2}\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=\dfrac{\sqrt{x}}{x+1}\). Find the instantaneous rate of change of \(f\) at \(x=4\).
If \(p(3)=5\) and \(p(8)=20\), find \(\int_3^8 p'(x)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus: \(\int_3^8 p'(x)\,dx=p(8)-p(3)=20-5=15\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=x^2+3x\) on \([1,4]\), find the value of \(c\) in \((1,4)\) guaranteed by the Mean Value Theorem.
Differentiate \(f(x)=\dfrac{x^3}{e^x}\).
A particle has velocity \(v(t)=2t^2-12t+10\) ft/s on \([0,7]\). Find the minimum value of the velocity on this interval.
Determine the intervals on which \(f(x)=(x-1)^2(x+2)\) is increasing.
questions.explanation: Expand and differentiate: \(f'(x)=3(x-1)(x+1)\). \(f'(x)>0\) when \(x<-1\) or \(x>1\). So \(f\) is increasing on \((-\infty,-1)\) and \((1,\infty)\).

questions.question: Which of the following functions is NOT differentiable at \(x=-2\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(x)=(x+2)^{1/3}\) has a vertical tangent at \(x=-2\) since \(f'(x)=\frac{1}{3}(x+2)^{-2/3}\to\infty\) as \(x\to-2\). The other three are smooth and differentiable at \(x=-2\).

questions.question: A liquid drains from a container at a rate of \(r(t)=8-t\) liters per hour. How many liters drain from \(t=0\) to \(t=5\) hours?

The derivative \(f'(x)\) changes from positive to negative at \(x=1\), from negative to positive at \(x=4\), and equals zero at \(x=7\) with \(f'\) negative on both sides. Classify each critical point.
options: Max at \(1\), min at \(4\), neither at \(7\)
Min at \(1\), max at \(4\), neither at \(7\)
Max at \(1\), min at \(4\), min at \(7\)
Min at \(1\), max at \(4\), max at \(7\)
questions.explanation: First Derivative Test: + to − ⇒ relative maximum at \(x=1\); − to + ⇒ relative minimum at \(x=4\); no sign change (negative on both sides) ⇒ neither at \(x=7\).

questions.question: Find the area under the curve \(y=e^x\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=2\).
At \(x=a\), a function satisfies \(f(a)>0\), \(f'(a)<0\), and \(f''(a)<0\). Which description best matches the behavior near \(x=a\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(a)>0\) means above the x‑axis; \(f'(a)<0\) means decreasing; \(f''(a)<0\) means concave down.

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_0^3(2x+1)\,dx\).
Find the area of the region enclosed by \(y=x\) and \(y=x^2\).
For \(f(x)=xe^x\), determine the interval(s) on which \(f\) is concave down.
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=e^x+xe^x=e^x(1+x)\), \(f''(x)=e^x(1+x)+e^x=e^x(2+x)\). Since \(e^x>0\) always, \(f''<0\) when \(2+x<0\) ⇒ \(x<-2\). So \(f\) is concave down on \((-\infty,-2)\).

questions.question: Find the equation of the tangent line to \(f(x)=\ln(x^2)\) at \(x=e\).
A 10‑ft ladder leans against a wall. The base slides away from the wall at 2 ft/s. How fast is the top of the ladder sliding down when the base is 6 ft from the wall?
questions.explanation: Let \(x\) = base from wall, \(y\) = height. \(x^2+y^2=100\). When \(x=6\): \(y=\sqrt{100-36}=8\). Differentiate: \(2x\frac{dx}{dt}+2y\frac{dy}{dt}=0\) ⇒ \(\frac{dy}{dt}=-\frac{x}{y}\frac{dx}{dt}=-\frac{6}{8}(2)=-\frac{3}{2}\) ft/s. The top slides down at \(\frac{3}{2}\) ft/s.

questions.question: A quantity decays according to \(Q(t)=500e^{-0.2t}\). How much remains after 5 time units? Express exactly.
Find all relative extrema of \(f(x)=-x^3+3x^2+9x-5\) using the First Derivative Test.
options: Relative minimum at \(x=-1\); relative maximum at \(x=3\)
Relative maximum at \(x=-1\); relative minimum at \(x=3\)
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=-3x^2+6x+9=-3(x^2-2x-3)=-3(x-3)(x+1)\). Critical: \(x=-1,3\). Sign of \(f'\): test \(x=0\): \(-3(-3)(1)=9>0\). So \(f'<0\) for \(x<-1\), \(f'>0\) for \(-1<x<3\), \(f'<0\) for \(x>3\). First Derivative Test: − to + ⇒ relative minimum at \(x=-1\); + to − ⇒ relative maximum at \(x=3\).

questions.question: Find the value of \(k\) that makes \(f(x)=\begin{cases}3x+k & x\le4\\x^2-5 & x>4\end{cases}\) continuous at \(x=4\).
Use the Trapezoidal Rule with \(n=3\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^3 x^2\,dx\).
Find the critical points of \(f(x)=2\sin x-x\) on \([0,2\pi]\).
The base of a solid is the region bounded by \(y=\sqrt{x}\) and \(y=0\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=4\). Cross sections perpendicular to the x‑axis are equilateral triangles. Find the volume.
questions.explanation: Side of each equilateral triangle = \(\sqrt{x}\). Area of equilateral triangle with side \(s\) is \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}s^2\). So area \(=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}x\). Volume \(=\int_0^4\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}x\,dx=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}\cdot\frac{x^2}{2}\big|_0^4=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}\cdot 8=2\sqrt{3}\).

questions.question: At what x‑value on \(y=\dfrac{1}{x^2}\) is the tangent line parallel to \(y=-4x+1\)?
Is \(f(x)=|3x-6|\) differentiable at \(x=2\)? Justify.
options: No, because the left and right derivatives are \(-3\) and \(3\) respectively
Yes, because the function is continuous at \(x=2\)
No, because the function is not defined at \(x=2\)
questions.explanation: For \(x<2\): \(f(x)=6-3x\), left derivative \(=-3\). For \(x>2\): \(f(x)=3x-6\), right derivative \(=3\). Since \(-3\ne3\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=2\).

questions.question: Let \(P(x)=\int_2^{x^4}\ln(t)\,dt\). Find \(P'(x)\), then evaluate \(P'(e)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC and chain rule: \(P'(x)=\ln(x^4)\cdot4x^3=4\ln(x^4)\cdot x^3=16x^3\ln x\). At \(x=e\): \(P'(e)=16e^3\ln e=16e^3(1)=16e^3\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\displaystyle\lim_{x\to0}\frac{e^x-1-x}{x^2}\).
questions.explanation: Form \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply L'Hôpital: \(\lim\frac{e^x-1}{2x}\). Still \(\frac{0}{0}\). Apply again: \(\lim\frac{e^x}{2}=\frac{1}{2}\).

questions.question: A closed cylindrical can must hold a volume of \(54\pi\) cm³. Find the radius and height that minimize the total surface area.
Use the Second Derivative Test to classify the critical points of \(f(x)=x^3-12x+5\).
options: Relative maximum at \(x=-2\); relative minimum at \(x=2\)
Relative minimum at \(x=-2\); relative maximum at \(x=2\)

questions.question: Use a left Riemann sum with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_2^4(x^2+1)\,dx\).
Find \(\dfrac{d}{dx}\left[\arcsin\!\left(\dfrac{x}{5}\right)\right]\).
A particle has position \(s(t)=t^3-9t^2+24t\). Find the acceleration at each moment when the velocity is zero.
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of \(f(x)=x^4-4x^3+4\) on \([-1,4]\).
options: Absolute max \(9\) at \(x=-1\); absolute min \(-23\) at \(x=3\)
Absolute max \(4\) at \(x=0\); absolute min \(-23\) at \(x=3\)
Absolute max \(9\) at \(x=-1\); absolute min \(0\) at \(x=0\)
Absolute max \(4\) at \(x=4\); absolute min \(-23\) at \(x=3\)

questions.question: Solve the initial value problem \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=2y\), \(y(0)=3\).
A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=3t^2-12\) ft/s on \([0,3]\). Find the total distance traveled.
Differentiate \(f(x)=\sin^4 x\).
questions.explanation: Write \(f(x)=(\sin x)^4\). Chain rule: \(f'(x)=4(\sin x)^3\cdot\cos x=4\sin^3 x\cos x\).

questions.question: Use linear approximation at \(x=5\) to estimate \(f(5.1)\) where \(f(x)=\dfrac{1}{x}\).
